Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but possibly with non-sequence characters.
Alphabet for the consensus of two or more molecular sequences.
Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions and possible ambiguity characters.
Format for sequence positions (feature location) as used in DDBJ/EMBL/GenBank database.
Report format for tandem repeats in a nucleotide sequence (format generated by the Sanger Centre quicktandem program).
Report format for inverted repeats in a nucleotide sequence (format generated by the Sanger Centre inverted program).
Report format for tandem repeats in a sequence (an EMBOSS report format).
Format of a report on exon-intron structure generated by EMBOSS est2genome.
Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by EMBOSS restrict program.
Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by EMBOSS restover program.
Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by REBASE database.
Format of results of a sequence database search using FASTA.
children.comment: This includes (typically) score data, alignment data and a histogram (of observed and expected distribution of E values.)

children.definition: XML format as produced by the NCBI Blast package
XML format as produced by the NCBI Blast package v2.
Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of BLAST.
children.comment: This includes score data, alignment data and summary table.

children.definition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of MSPCrunch.
Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of Smith Waterman.
Format of EMBASSY domain hits file (DHF) of hits (sequences) with domain classification information.
children.comment: The hits are relatives to a SCOP or CATH family and are found from a search of a sequence database.

children.definition: Format of EMBASSY ligand hits file (LHF) of database hits (sequences) with ligand classification information.
children.comment: The hits are putative ligand-binding sequences and are found from a search of a sequence database.

children.definition: Format of results of a search of the InterPro database showing matches of query protein sequence(s) to InterPro entries.
children.comment: The report includes a classification of regions in a query protein sequence which are assigned to a known InterPro protein family or group.

children.definition: Format of results of a search of the InterPro database showing matches between protein sequence(s) and signatures for an InterPro entry.
children.comment: The table presents matches between query proteins (rows) and signature methods (columns) for this entry. Alternatively the sequence(s) might be from from the InterPro entry itself. The match position in the protein sequence and match status (true positive, false positive etc) are indicated.

children.definition: Results format for searches of the InterPro database.
Dirichlet distribution HMMER format.
Dirichlet distribution MEME format.
Format of a report from the HMMER package on the emission and transition counts of a hidden Markov model.
Format of a regular expression pattern from the Prosite database.
Format of an EMBOSS sequence pattern.
A motif in the format generated by the MEME program.
Sequence profile (sequence classifier) format used in the PROSITE database.
A profile (sequence classifier) in the format used in the JASPAR database.
Format of the model of random sequences used by MEME.
HMMER profile HMM file for HMMER versions 2.x
HMMER profile HMM file for HMMER versions 3.x
Format of a hidden Markov model representation used by the HMMER package.
FASTA-style format for multiple sequences aligned by HMMER package to an HMM.
FASTA-style format for multiple sequences aligned by HMMER package to an HMM.
Fasta format variant with database name before ID.
FASTA format including NCBI-style IDs.
FASTA sequence format including NCBI-style GIs.
Plain old FASTA sequence format (unspecified format for IDs).
NCBI FASTA sequence format with NCBI-style IDs.
children.comment: There are several variants of this.

children.definition: Fasta format for (aligned) sequences.

The A2M format is used as the primary format for multiple alignments of protein or nucleic-acid sequences in the SAM suite of tools. It is a small modification of FASTA format for sequences and is compatible with most tools that read FASTA.
Color space FASTA format sequence variant.
children.comment: FASTA format extended for color space information.

children.definition: The A2M format is used as the primary format for multiple alignments of protein or nucleic-acid sequences in the SAM suite of tools. It is a small modification of FASTA format for sequences and is compatible with most tools that read FASTA.
A text format resembling FASTA format.
children.comment: This concept may also be used for the many non-standard FASTA-like formats.

children.definition: Format of multiple sequences aligned by DIALIGN package.
EMBASSY 'domain alignment file' (DAF) format, containing a sequence alignment of protein domains belonging to the same SCOP or CATH family.
children.comment: The format is clustal-like and includes annotation of domain family classification information.

children.definition: Format for alignment of molecular sequences to MEME profiles (position-dependent scoring matrices) as generated by the MAST tool from the MEME package.
Format used by the HMMER package for an alignment of a sequence against a hidden Markov model database.
Format used by the HMMER package for of an alignment of a hidden Markov model against a sequence database.
Format of PHYLIP phylogenetic distance matrix data.
children.comment: Data Type must include the distance matrix, probably as pairs of sequence identifiers with a distance (integer or float).

children.definition: Dendrogram (tree file) format generated by ClustalW.
Raw data file format used by Phylip from which a phylogenetic tree is directly generated or plotted.
PHYLIP file format for continuous quantitative character data.
PHYLIP file format for phylogenetics character frequency data.
Format of PHYLIP discrete states data.
Format of PHYLIP cliques data.
Phylogenetic tree data format used by the PHYLIP program.
The format of an entry from the TreeBASE database of phylogenetic data.
The format of an entry from the TreeFam database of phylogenetic data.
Format for distances, such as Branch Score distance, between two or more phylogenetic trees as used by the Phylip package.
Format of an entry from the DSSP database (Dictionary of Secondary Structure in Proteins).
children.comment: The DSSP database is built using the DSSP application which defines secondary structure, geometrical features and solvent exposure of proteins, given atomic coordinates in PDB format.

children.definition: Entry format of the HSSP database (Homology-derived Secondary Structure in Proteins).
Format of local RNA secondary structure components with free energy values, generated by the Vienna RNA package/server.
children.text: Vienna local RNA secondary structure format

children.definition: Format of RNA secondary structure in dot-bracket notation, originally generated by the Vienna RNA package/server.
Format of local RNA secondary structure components with free energy values, generated by the Vienna RNA package/server.
children.text: Vienna local RNA secondary structure format

children.definition: Entry format of PDB database in PDB format.
Entry format of PDB database in mmCIF format.
Amino acid index format used by the AAindex database.
Format of output of the Pcons Model Quality Assessment Program (MQAP).
children.comment: Pcons ranks protein models by assessing their quality based on the occurrence of recurring common three-dimensional structural patterns. Pcons returns a score reflecting the overall global quality and a score for each individual residue in the protein reflecting the local residue quality.

children.definition: Format of output of the ProQ protein model quality predictor.
children.comment: ProQ is a neural network-based predictor that predicts the quality of a protein model based on the number of structural features.

children.definition: A report format for the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reaction(s) in a format generated by EMBOSS findkm. This includes Michaelis Menten plot, Hanes Woolf plot, Michaelis Menten constant (Km) and maximum velocity (Vmax).
Report format on PCR primers and hybridisation oligos as generated by Whitehead primer3 program.
Format of MIRA sequence trace information file.
Common Assembly Format (CAF). A sequence assembly format including contigs, base-call qualities, and other metadata.
Sequence assembly project file EXP format.
PHD sequence trace format to store serialised chromatogram data (reads).
Format of Affymetrix data file of raw image data.
Format of Affymetrix data file of information about (raw) expression levels of the individual probes.
Format of affymetrix gene cluster files (hc-genes.txt, hc-chips.txt) from hierarchical clustering.
Affymetrix data file format for information about experimental conditions and protocols.
children.exact_synonyms: Affymetrix experimental conditions data file format

children.definition: Format of Affymetrix data file of information about (normalised) expression levels of the individual probes.
The format of an entry from the HET group dictionary (HET groups from PDB files).
Format of bibliographic reference as used by the PubMed database.
Format for abstracts of scientific articles from the Medline database.
children.comment: Bibliographic reference information including citation information is included

children.definition: CiteXplore 'core' citation format including title, journal, authors and abstract.
CiteXplore 'all' citation format includes all known details such as Mesh terms and cross-references.
Article format of the PubMed Central database.
OSCAR format of annotated chemical text.
children.comment: OSCAR (Open-Source Chemistry Analysis Routines) software performs chemistry-specific parsing of chemical documents. It attempts to identify chemical names, ontology concepts, and chemical data from a document.

children.definition: Map of a plasmid (circular DNA) in PlasMapper TextMap format.
Phylogenetic tree Newick (text) format.
Phylogenetic tree TreeCon (text) format.
Phylogenetic tree Nexus (text) format.
ACEDB sequence format.
Codata entry format.
EMBL entry format.
Geneseq sequence format.
A text format resembling EMBL entry format.
children.comment: This concept may be used for the many non-standard EMBL-like text formats.

children.definition: Staden experiment file format.
FASTQ short read format ignoring quality scores.
FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8.
children.comment: Starting in Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8, the Phred scores 0 to 2 have a slightly different meaning. The values 0 and 1 are no longer used and the value 2, encoded by ASCII 66 "B", is used also at the end of reads as a Read Segment Quality Control Indicator.

children.definition: FASTQ Illumina 1.3 short read format.
FASTQ short read format with phred quality.
FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format.
children.comment: Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format can encode a Solexa/Illumina quality score from -5 to 62 using ASCII 59 to 126 (although in raw read data Solexa scores from -5 to 40 only are expected)

children.definition: FASTQ Solexa/Illumina 1.0 short read format.
FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format.
children.comment: Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format can encode a Solexa/Illumina quality score from -5 to 62 using ASCII 59 to 126 (although in raw read data Solexa scores from -5 to 40 only are expected)

children.definition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8.
children.comment: Starting in Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8, the Phred scores 0 to 2 have a slightly different meaning. The values 0 and 1 are no longer used and the value 2, encoded by ASCII 66 "B", is used also at the end of reads as a Read Segment Quality Control Indicator.

children.definition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for SOLiD data.
children.comment: For SOLiD data, the sequence is in color space, except the first position. The quality values are those of the Sanger format.

children.definition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from 454 sequencers.
FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences).
children.comment: Phred quality scores  are defined as a property which is logarithmically related to the base-calling error probabilities.

children.definition: A text format resembling FASTQ short read format.
children.comment: This concept may be used for non-standard FASTQ short read-like formats.

children.definition: Fitch program format.
GCG sequence file format.
children.comment: GCG SSF (single sequence file) file format.

children.definition: GCG sequence file format.
children.comment: GCG SSF (single sequence file) file format.

children.definition: GCG MSF (multiple sequence file) file format.
Rich sequence format.
children.comment: RSF-format files contain one or more sequences that may or may not be related. In addition to the sequence data, each sequence can be annotated with descriptive sequence information (from the GCG manual).

children.definition: Some format based on the GCG format.
Genbank entry format.
Genpept protein entry format.
children.comment: Currently identical to refseqp format

children.definition: A text format resembling GenBank entry (plain text) format.
children.comment: This concept may be used for the non-standard GenBank-like text formats.

children.definition: Hennig86 output sequence format.
Intelligenetics sequence format.
Intelligenetics sequence format (strict version).
Jackknifer interleaved and non-interleaved sequence format.
Mase program sequence format.
Mega interleaved and non-interleaved sequence format.
NBRF/PIR entry sequence format.
Nexus/paup interleaved sequence format.
PDB sequence format (ATOM lines).
children.comment: pdb format in EMBOSS.

children.definition: PDB nucleotide sequence format (ATOM lines).
children.comment: pdbnuc format in EMBOSS.

children.definition: PDB nucleotide sequence format (SEQRES lines).
children.comment: pdbnucseq format in EMBOSS.

children.definition: PDB sequence format (SEQRES lines).
children.comment: pdbseq format in EMBOSS.

children.definition: Raw sequence format with no non-sequence characters.
Refseq protein entry sequence format.
children.comment: Currently identical to genpept format

children.definition: Staden suite sequence format.
Stockholm multiple sequence alignment format (used by Pfam and Rfam).
DNA strider output sequence format.
UniProtKB entry sequence format.
A text sequence format resembling uniprotkb entry format.
Plain text sequence format (essentially unformatted).
NCBI ASN.1-based sequence format.
EMBOSS debugging trace sequence format of full internal data content.
Jackknifer output sequence non-interleaved format.
Nexus/paup non-interleaved sequence format.
GFF feature file format with sequence in the header.
General Feature Format (GFF) of sequence features.
GFF3 feature file format with sequence.
Genome Variation Format (GVF). A GFF3-compatible format with defined header and attribute tags for sequence variation.
mirGFF3 is a common format for microRNA data resulting from small-RNA RNA-Seq workflows.
children.comment: mirGFF3 is a specialisation of GFF3; produced by small-RNA-Seq analysis workflows, usable and convertible with the miRTop API (https://mirtop.readthedocs.io/en/latest/), and consumable by tools for downstream analysis.

children.definition: Generic Feature Format version 3 (GFF3) of sequence features.
Gene Transfer Format (GTF), a restricted version of GFF.
GFF feature format (of indeterminate version).
EMBOSS debugging trace feature format of full internal data content.
ClustalW format for (aligned) sequences.
EMBOSS alignment format for debugging trace of full internal data content.
Pearson MARKX0 alignment format.
Pearson MARKX1 alignment format.
Pearson MARKX10 alignment format.
Pearson MARKX2 alignment format.
Pearson MARKX3 alignment format.
Some variant of Pearson MARKX alignment format.
Alignment format for start and end of matches between sequence pairs.
Mega format for (typically aligned) sequences.
Mega non-interleaved format for (typically aligned) sequences.
Some variant of Mega format for (typically aligned) sequences.
Phylip format for (aligned) sequences.
Phylip non-interleaved format for (aligned) sequences.
Phylip multiple alignment sequence format, less stringent than PHYLIP format.
children.comment: It differs from Phylip Format (format_1997) on length of the ID sequence. There no length restrictions on the ID, but whitespaces aren't allowed in the sequence ID/Name because one space separates the longest ID and the beginning of the sequence. Sequences IDs must be padded to the longest ID length.

children.definition: Phylip multiple alignment sequence format, less stringent than PHYLIP sequential format (format_1998).
children.comment: It differs from Phylip sequential format (format_1997) on length of the ID sequence. There no length restrictions on the ID, but whitespaces aren't allowed in the sequence ID/Name because one space separates the longest ID and the beginning of the sequence. Sequences IDs must be padded to the longest ID length.

children.definition: Some variant of Phylip format for (aligned) sequences.
Alignment format for score values for pairs of sequences.
SELEX format for (aligned) sequences.
EMBOSS simple multiple alignment format.
Simple multiple sequence (alignment) format for SRS.
Simple sequence pair (alignment) format for SRS.
T-Coffee program alignment format.
Treecon format for (aligned) sequences.
Abstract format used by MedLine database.
OBO ontology text format.
Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
Alphabet for any protein sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
Alphabet for a molecular sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
Alphabet for a molecular sequence without any unknown positions or ambiguity characters.
Sequence Alignment/Map (SAM) format for alignment of nucleotide sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). May contain base-call and alignment qualities and other data.
children.comment: The format supports short and long reads (up to 128Mbp) produced by different sequencing platforms and is used to hold mapped data within the GATK and across the Broad Institute, the Sanger Centre, and throughout the 1000 Genomes project.

children.definition: ACE sequence assembly format including contigs, base-call qualities, and other metadata (version Aug 1998 and onwards).
Human ENCODE narrow peak format.
children.comment: Format that covers both the broad peak format and narrow peak format from ENCODE.

children.definition: Human ENCODE broad peak format.
Human ENCODE peak format.
children.comment: Format that covers both the broad peak format and narrow peak format from ENCODE.

children.definition: BED file format where each feature is described by chromosome, start, end, name, score, and strand.
children.comment: Tab delimited data in strict BED format - no non-standard columns allowed; column count forced to 6

children.definition: A BED file where each feature is described by all twelve columns.
children.comment: Tab delimited data in strict BED format - no non-standard columns allowed; column count forced to 12

children.definition: Browser Extensible Data (BED) format of sequence annotation track that strictly does not contain non-standard fields beyond the first 3 columns.
children.comment: Galaxy allows BED files to contain non-standard fields beyond the first 3 columns, some other implementations do not.

children.definition: Tabular format of chromosome names and sizes used by Galaxy.
children.comment: Galaxy allows BED files to contain non-standard fields beyond the first 3 columns, some other implementations do not.

children.definition: Browser Extensible Data (BED) format of sequence annotation track, typically to be displayed in a genome browser.
children.comment: BED detail format includes 2 additional columns (http://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat#format1.7) and BED 15 includes 3 additional columns for experiment scores (http://genomewiki.ucsc.edu/index.php/Microarray_track).

children.definition: Wiggle format (WIG) of a sequence annotation track that consists of a value for each sequence position. Typically to be displayed in a genome browser.
PSL format of alignments, typically generated by BLAT or psLayout. Can be displayed in a genome browser like a sequence annotation track.
Multiple Alignment Format (MAF) supporting alignments of whole genomes with rearrangements, directions, multiple pieces to the alignment, and so forth.
children.comment: Typically generated by Multiz and TBA aligners; can be displayed in a genome browser like a sequence annotation track. This should not be confused with MIRA Assembly Format or Mutation Annotation Format.

children.definition: genePred table format for gene prediction tracks.
children.comment: genePred format has 3 main variations (http://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat#format9 http://www.broadinstitute.org/software/igv/genePred). They reflect UCSC Browser DB tables.

children.definition: Personal Genome SNP (pgSnp) format for sequence variation tracks (indels and polymorphisms), supported by the UCSC Genome Browser.
axt format of alignments, typically produced from BLASTZ.
LAV format of alignments generated by BLASTZ and LASTZ.
Pileup format of alignment of sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). Contains aligned bases per base of the reference sequence(s).

Genomic Variant Call Format (gVCF) is a version of VCF that includes not only the positions that are variant when compared to a reference genome, but also the non-variant positions as ranges, including metrics of confidence that the positions in the range are actually non-variant e.g. minimum read-depth and genotype quality.
Variant Call Format (VCF) is tabular format for storing genomic sequence variations.
children.comment: 1000 Genomes Project has its own specification for encoding structural variations in VCF (https://www.internationalgenome.org/wiki/Analysis/Variant%20Call%20Format/VCF%20(Variant%20Call%20Format)%20version%204.0/encoding-structural-variants). This is based on VCF version 4.0 and not directly compatible with VCF version 4.3.

'GTrack' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats, and particular to its subset, the 'GTrack ecosystem' (GTrack, GSuite, BTrack). 'GTrack' is the tabular format for representing features of sequences and genomes.
children.definition: GTrack is a generic and optimised tabular format for genome or sequence feature tracks. GTrack unifies the power of other track formats (e.g. GFF3, BED, WIG), and while optimised in size, adds more flexibility, customisation, and automation ("machine understandability").
Cytoband format for chromosome cytobands.
children.comment: Reflects a UCSC Browser DB table.

children.definition: Tabular Molecular Interaction format (MITAB), standardised by HUPO PSI MI.
A human-readable encoding for the Web Ontology Language (OWL).
A syntax for writing OWL class expressions.
children.comment: This format was influenced by the OWL Abstract Syntax and the DL style syntax.

children.definition: A superset of the "Description-Logic Knowledge Representation System Specification from the KRSS Group of the ARPA Knowledge Sharing Effort".
children.comment: This format is used in Protege 4.

children.definition: The Terse RDF Triple Language (Turtle) is a human-friendly serialisation format for RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs.
children.comment: The SPARQL Query Language incorporates a very similar syntax.

children.definition: A plain text serialisation format for RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs, and a subset of the Turtle (Terse RDF Triple Language) format.
children.comment: N-Triples should not be confused with Notation 3 which is a superset of Turtle.

children.definition: A shorthand non-XML serialisation of Resource Description Framework model, designed with human-readability in mind.
The MAP file describes SNPs and is used by the Plink package.
The PED file describes individuals and genetic data and is used by the Plink package.
The PED/MAP file describes data used by the Plink package.
File format of a CT (Connectivity Table) file from the RNAstructure package.
XRNA old input style format.
Format for the Genetic Data Environment (GDE).
Encapsulated PostScript format
PostScript format
MAGE-TAB textual format for microarray expression data, standardised by MGED (now FGED).
WEGO native format used by the Web Gene Ontology Annotation Plot application.   Tab-delimited format with gene names and others GO IDs (columns) with one annotation record per line.
Tab-delimited format for gene expression levels table, calculated as Reads Per Kilobase per Million (RPKM) mapped reads.
children.comment: For example a 1kb transcript with 1000 alignments in a sample of 10 million reads (out of which 8 million reads can be mapped) will have RPKM = 1000/(1 * 8) = 125

children.definition: A data format for specifying parameter estimation problems in systems biology.
Tabular data represented as tab-separated values in a text file.
Tabular data represented as comma-separated values in a text file.
Tabular data represented as values in a text file delimited by some character.
Format of the cytoscape input file of gene expression ratios or values are specified over one or more experiments.
Ensembl standard format for variation data.
Text-based tagged file format for medical images generated using the MetaImage software package.
Nearly Raw Rasta Data format designed to support scientific visualisation and image processing involving N-dimensional raster data.
File format used for scripts written in the R programming language for execution within the R software environment, typically for statistical computation and graphics.
File format used for scripts for the Statistical Package for the Social Sciences.
Reporter Code Count-A data file (.csv) output by the Nanostring nCounter Digital Analyzer, which contains gene sample information, probe information and probe counts.
ARFF (Attribute-Relation File Format) is an ASCII text file format that describes a list of instances sharing a set of attributes.
children.comment: This file format is for machine learning.

children.definition: AFG is a single text-based file assembly format  that holds read and consensus information together
The bedGraph format allows display of continuous-valued data in track format. This display type is useful for probability scores and transcriptome data
children.comment: Holds a tab-delimited chromosome /start /end / datavalue dataset.

children.definition: Tabular format of chromosome names and sizes used by Galaxy.
children.comment: Galaxy allows BED files to contain non-standard fields beyond the first 3 columns, some other implementations do not.

children.definition: Custom Sequence annotation track format used by Galaxy.
children.comment: Used for tracks/track views within galaxy.

children.definition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format.
children.comment: Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format can encode a Solexa/Illumina quality score from -5 to 62 using ASCII 59 to 126 (although in raw read data Solexa scores from -5 to 40 only are expected)

children.definition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8.
children.comment: Starting in Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8, the Phred scores 0 to 2 have a slightly different meaning. The values 0 and 1 are no longer used and the value 2, encoded by ASCII 66 "B", is used also at the end of reads as a Read Segment Quality Control Indicator.

children.definition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for SOLiD data.
children.comment: For SOLiD data, the sequence is in color space, except the first position. The quality values are those of the Sanger format.

children.definition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from 454 sequencers.
FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences).
children.comment: Phred quality scores  are defined as a property which is logarithmically related to the base-calling error probabilities.

children.definition: mzTab is a tab-delimited format for mass spectrometry-based proteomics and metabolomics results.
The Investigation / Study / Assay (ISA) tab-delimited (TAB) format incorporates metadata fromexperiments employing a combination of technologies.
children.comment: ISA-TAB is based on MAGE-TAB. Other than tabular, the ISA model can also be represented in RDF, and in JSON (compliable with a set of defined JSON Schemata).

children.definition: SBtab is a tabular format for biochemical network models.
Biological Expression Language (BEL) is a textual format for representing scientific findings in life sciences in a computable form.
AGP is a tabular format for a sequence assembly (a contig, a scaffold/supercontig, or a chromosome).
Tab-delimited text files of GenePattern that contain a column for each sample, a row for each gene, and an expression value for each gene in each sample.
"Raw" result file from Mascot database search.
Format of peak list files from Andromeda search engine (MaxQuant) that consist of arbitrarily many spectra.
The LocARNA PP format combines sequence or alignment information and (respectively, single or consensus) ensemble probabilities into an PP 2.0 record.
children.comment: Format for multiple aligned or single sequences together with the probabilistic description of the (consensus) RNA secondary structure ensemble by probabilities of base pairs, base pair stackings, and base pairs and unpaired bases in the loop of base pairs.

children.definition: Input format used by the Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP).
children.comment: The Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) is a National Institutes of Health (NIH) sponsored repository charged to archive, curate and distribute information produced by studies investigating the interaction of genotype and phenotype.

children.definition: The BIological Observation Matrix (BIOM) is a format for representing biological sample by observation contingency tables in broad areas of comparative omics. The primary use of this format is to represent OTU tables and metagenome tables.
children.comment: BIOM is a recognised standard for the Earth Microbiome Project, and is a project supported by Genomics Standards Consortium. Supported in QIIME, Mothur, MEGAN, etc.

children.definition: "Raw" result file from SEQUEST database search.

children.comment: 'GSuite' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats, and particular to its subset, the 'GTrack ecosystem' (GTrack, GSuite, BTrack). 'GSuite' is the tabular format for an annotated collection of individual GTrack files.
children.definition: GSuite is a tabular format for collections of genome or sequence feature tracks, suitable for integrative multi-track analysis. GSuite contains links to genome/sequence tracks, with additional metadata.

children.comment: Multi-Crop Passport Descriptors is a format available in 2 successive versions, V.1 (FAO/IPGRI 2001) and V.2 (FAO/Bioversity 2012).
children.definition: The FAO/Bioversity/IPGRI Multi-Crop Passport Descriptors (MCPD) is an international standard format for exchange of germplasm information.
Native textual export format of annotated scientific text from PubTator.

A family of similar formats of text annotation, used by BRAT and other tools, known as BioNLP Shared Task format (BioNLP 2009 Shared Task on Event Extraction, BioNLP Shared Task 2011, BioNLP Shared Task 2013), BRAT format, BRAT standoff format, and similar.
SQL (Structured Query Language) is the de-facto standard query language (format of queries) for querying and manipulating data in relational databases.

XQuery (XML Query) is a query language (format of queries) for querying and manipulating structured and unstructured data, usually in the form of XML, text, and with vendor-specific extensions for other data formats (JSON, binary, etc.).
SPARQL (SPARQL Protocol and RDF Query Language) is a semantic query language for querying and manipulating data stored in Resource Description Framework (RDF) format.
children.exact_synonyms: SPARQL Protocol and RDF Query Language

children.definition: The GEN file format contains genetic data and describes SNPs.
The SAMPLE file format contains information about each individual i.e. individual IDs, covariates, phenotypes and missing data proportions, from a GWAS study.
SDF is one of a family of chemical-data file formats developed by MDL Information Systems; it is intended especially for structural information.
An MDL Molfile is a file format for holding information about the atoms, bonds, connectivity and coordinates of a molecule.
Complete, portable representation of a SYBYL molecule. ASCII file which contains all the information needed to reconstruct a SYBYL molecule.
format for the LaTeX document preparation system
children.comment: uses the TeX typesetting program format

children.definition: Tab-delimited text file format used by Eland - the read-mapping program distributed by Illumina with its sequencing analysis pipeline - which maps short Solexa sequence reads to the human reference genome.
GML (Graph Modeling Language) is a text file format supporting network data with a very easy syntax. It is used by Graphlet, Pajek, yEd, LEDA and NetworkX.
FASTG is a format for faithfully representing genome assemblies in the face of allelic polymorphism and assembly uncertainty.
children.comment: It is called FASTG, like FASTA, but the G stands for "graph".

children.definition: . proBED is an adaptation of BED (format_3003), which was extended to meet specific requirements entailed by proteomics data.
GenePix Results (GPR) text file format developed by Axon Instruments that is used to save GenePix Results data.
A standardized file format for data exchange in mass spectrometry, initially developed for infrared spectrometry.
children.comment: JCAMP-DX is an ASCII based format and therefore not very compact even though it includes standards for file compression.

children.definition: The XYZ chemical file format is widely supported by many programs, although many slightly different XYZ file formats coexist (Tinker XYZ, UniChem XYZ, etc.). Basic information stored for each atom in the system are x, y and z coordinates and atom element/atomic number.
children.comment: XYZ files are structured in this way:  First line contains the number of atoms in the file.  Second line contains a title, comment, or filename. Remaining lines contain atom information. Each line starts with the element symbol, followed by x, y and z coordinates in angstroms separated by whitespace. Multiple molecules or frames can be contained within one file, so it supports trajectory storage. XYZ files can be directly represented by a molecular viewer, as they contain all the basic information needed to build the 3D model.

children.definition: AMBER trajectory (also called mdcrd), with 10 coordinates per line and format F8.3 (fixed point notation with field width 8 and 3 decimal places).
GROMACS MD package top textual files define an entire structure system topology, either directly, or by including itp files.
children.comment: There is currently no tool available for conversion between GROMACS topology format and other formats, due to the internal differences in both approaches. There is, however, a method to convert small molecules parameterized with AMBER force-field into GROMACS format, allowing simulations of these systems with GROMACS MD package.

children.definition: AMBER Prmtop file (version 7) is a structure topology text file divided in several sections designed to be parsed easily using simple Fortran code. Each section contains particular topology information, such as atom name, charge, mass, angles, dihedrals, etc.
comment: It can be modified manually, but as the size of the system increases, the hand-editing becomes increasingly complex. AMBER Parameter-Topology file format is used extensively by the AMBER software suite and is referred to as the Prmtop file for short.

version 7 is written to distinguish it from old versions of AMBER Prmtop. Similarly to HDF5, it is a completely different format, according to AMBER group: a drastic change to the file format occurred with the 2004 release of Amber 7 (http://ambermd.org/prmtop.pdf)

children.definition: X-Plor Protein Structure Files (PSF) are structure topology files used by NAMD and CHARMM molecular simulations programs. PSF files contain six main sections of interest: atoms, bonds, angles, dihedrals, improper dihedrals (force terms used to maintain planarity) and cross-terms.
children.comment: The high similarity in the functional form of the two potential energy functions used by AMBER and CHARMM force-fields gives rise to the possible use of one force-field within the other MD engine. Therefore, the conversion of PSF files to AMBER Prmtop format is possible with the use of AMBER chamber (CHARMM - AMBER) program.

children.definition: GROMACS itp files (include topology) contain structure topology information, and are tipically included in GROMACS topology files (GROMACS top). Itp files are used to define individual (or multiple) components of a topology as a separate file. This is particularly useful if there is a molecule that is used frequently, and also reduces the size of the system topology file, splitting it in different parts.
children.comment: GROMACS itp files are used also to define position restrictions on the molecule, or to define the force field parameters for a particular ligand.

children.definition: AMBER coordinate/restart file with 6 coordinates per line and decimal format F12.7 (fixed point notation with field width 12 and 7 decimal places)
Format of CHARMM Residue Topology Files (RTF), which define groups by including the atoms, the properties of the group, and bond and charge information.
children.comment: There is currently no tool available for conversion between GROMACS topology format and other formats, due to the internal differences in both approaches. There is, however, a method to convert small molecules parameterized with AMBER force-field into GROMACS format, allowing simulations of these systems with GROMACS MD package.

children.definition: AMBER frcmod (Force field Modification) is a file format to store any modification to the standard force field needed for a particular molecule to be properly represented in the simulation.
AMBER Object File Format library files (OFF library files) store residue libraries (forcefield residue parameters).

MReData is a text based data standard for processed NMR data. It is relying on SDF molecule data and allows to store assignments of NMR peaks to molecule features.  The NMR-extracted data (or "NMReDATA") includes: Chemical shift,scalar coupling, 2D correlation, assignment, etc.
children.comment: NMReData is a text based data standard for processed NMR data. It is relying on SDF molecule data and allows to store assignments of NMR peaks to molecule features. The NMR-extracted data (or "NMReDATA") includes: Chemical shift,scalar coupling, 2D correlation, assignment, etc. Find more in the paper at D. Jeannerat, Magn. Reson. in Chem., 2017, 55, 7-14.

children.definition: BpForms is a string format for concretely representing the primary structures of biopolymers, including DNA, RNA, and proteins that include non-canonical nucleic and amino acids. See https://www.bpforms.org for more information.

children.comment: The first 4 bytes of any trr file containing 1993. See https://github.com/galaxyproject/galaxy/pull/6597/files#diff-409951594551183dbf886e24de6cb129R760
children.definition: Format of trr files that contain the trajectory of a simulation experiment used by GROMACS.
The Matrix Market matrix (MTX) format stores numerical or pattern matrices in a dense (array format) or sparse (coordinate format) representation.

BcForms is a format for abstractly describing the molecular structure (atoms and bonds) of macromolecular complexes as a collection of subunits and crosslinks. Each subunit can be described with BpForms (http://edamontology.org/format_3909) or SMILES (http://edamontology.org/data_2301). BcForms uses an ontology of crosslinks to abstract the chemical details of crosslinks from the descriptions of complexes (see https://bpforms.org/crosslink.html).
children.comment: BcForms is related to http://edamontology.org/format_3909. (BcForms uses BpForms to describe subunits which are DNA, RNA, or protein polymers.) However, that format isn't the parent of BcForms. BcForms is similarly related to SMILES (http://edamontology.org/data_2301).

children.definition: N-Quads is a line-based, plain text format for encoding an RDF dataset. It includes information about the graph each triple belongs to.
children.comment: N-Quads should not be confused with N-Triples which does not contain graph information.

children.definition: BioNetGen is a format for the specification and simulation of rule-based models of biochemical systems, including signal transduction, metabolic, and genetic regulatory networks.

Graphical Fragment Assembly captures sequence graphs as the product of an assembly, a representation of variation in genomes, splice graphs in genes, or even overlap between reads from long-read sequencing technology.

Graphical Fragment Assembly captures sequence graphs as the product of an assembly, a representation of variation in genomes, splice graphs in genes, or even overlap between reads from long-read sequencing technology.
The CONTIG format used for output of the SOAPdenovo alignment program. It contains contig sequences generated without using mate pair information.
The CHAIN format describes a pairwise alignment that allow gaps in both sequences simultaneously and is used by the UCSC Genome Browser.
The NET file format is used to describe the data that underlie the net alignment annotations in the UCSC Genome Browser.
Format of QMAP files generated for methylation data from an internal BGI pipeline.
An emerging format for high-level Galaxy workflow description.
Compact Idiosyncratic Gapped Alignment Report format is a compressed (run-length encoded) pairwise alignment format. It is useful for representing long (e.g. genomic) pairwise alignments.
Format for scripts writtenin Python - a widely used high-level programming language for general-purpose programming.
Format for scripts written in Perl - a family of high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming languages.

Format for scripts written in the R language - an open source programming language and software environment for statistical computing and graphics that is supported by the R Foundation for Statistical Computing.
A file format for making dynamic documents (R Markdown scripts) with the R language.
A configuration file used by various programs to store settings that are specific to their respective software.
The file format for MATLAB scripts or functions.
Textual format.
children.comment: Data in text format can be compressed into binary format, or can be a value of an XML element or attribute. Markup formats are not considered textual (or more precisely, not plain-textual).

children.definition: Entry format of PDB database in PDBML (XML) format.
Format of Taverna workflows.
The format of iHOP (Information Hyperlinked over Proteins) text-mining result.
OSCAR format of annotated chemical text.
children.comment: OSCAR (Open-Source Chemistry Analysis Routines) software performs chemistry-specific parsing of chemical documents. It attempts to identify chemical names, ontology concepts, and chemical data from a document.

children.definition: DAS sequence (XML) format (any type).
DAS sequence (XML) format (nucleotide-only).
children.comment: The use of this format is deprecated.

children.definition: DAS GFF (XML) feature format.
XML format for EMBL entries.
XML format for EMBL entries.
XML format for EMBL entries.
An XML format for EMBL entries.
children.comment: This is a placeholder for other more specific concepts. It should not normally be used for annotation.

children.definition: An XML format resembling EMBL entry format.
children.comment: This concept may be used for the any non-standard EMBL-like XML formats.

children.definition: Entry format (XML) for the STRING database of protein interaction.

children.comment: 'BioXSD' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats. 'BioXSD in XML' is the XML format based on the common, unified 'BioXSD data model', a.k.a. 'BioXSD|BioJSON|BioYAML'.
children.definition: BioXSD-schema-based XML format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, Web services, and object-oriented programming.
OBO ontology XML format.
Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML), the standard XML format for models of biological processes such as for example metabolism, cell signaling, and gene regulation.
Systems Biology Result Markup Language (SBRML), the standard XML format for simulated or calculated results (e.g. trajectories) of systems biology models.
EBI Application Result XML is a format returned by sequence similarity search Web services at EBI.
Protein affinity format (PSI-PAR), standardised by HUPO PSI MI. It is compatible with PSI MI XML (MIF) and uses the same XML Schema.
XML Molecular Interaction Format (MIF), standardised by HUPO PSI MI.
phyloXML is a standardised XML format for phylogenetic trees, networks, and associated data.
NeXML is a standardised XML format for rich phyloinformatic data.
MAGE-ML XML format for microarray expression data, standardised by MGED (now FGED).
GCDML XML format for genome and metagenome metadata according to MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS information standards, standardised by the Genomic Standards Consortium (GSC).
CopasiML, the native format of COPASI.
CellML, the format for mathematical models of biological and other networks.
mzML format for raw spectrometer output data, standardised by HUPO PSI MSS.
children.comment: mzML is the successor and unifier of the mzData format developed by PSI and mzXML developed at the Seattle Proteome Center.

children.definition: TraML (Transition Markup Language) is the format for mass spectrometry transitions, standardised by HUPO PSI MSS.
mzIdentML is the exchange format for peptides and proteins identified from mass spectra, standardised by HUPO PSI PI. It can be used for outputs of proteomics search engines.

mzQuantML is the format for quantitation values associated with peptides, proteins and small molecules from mass spectra, standardised by HUPO PSI PI. It can be used for outputs of quantitation software for proteomics.
GelML is the format for describing the process of gel electrophoresis, standardised by HUPO PSI PS.

spML is the format for describing proteomics sample processing, other than using gels, prior to mass spectrometric protein identification, standardised by HUPO PSI PS. It may also be applicable for metabolomics.
Resource Description Framework (RDF) XML format.
children.comment: RDF/XML is a serialisation syntax for OWL DL, but not for OWL Full.

children.definition: OWL ontology XML serialisation format.
RNA Markup Language.
XML format as produced by the NCBI Blast package
Microsoft Excel spreadsheet format.
Bioinformatics Sequence Markup Language format.
Microsoft Word format.
Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) is an XML-based vector image format for two-dimensional graphics with support for interactivity and animation.
children.comment: The SVG specification is an open standard developed by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) since 1999.

children.definition: Open data format for the storage, exchange, and processing of peptide sequence assignments of MS/MS scans, intended to provide a common data output format for many different MS/MS search engines and subsequent peptide-level analyses.
Graphical Pathway Markup Language (GPML) is an XML format used for exchanging biological pathways.
imzML metadata is a data format for mass spectrometry imaging metadata.
children.comment: imzML data are recorded in 2 files: '.imzXML' is a metadata XML file based on mzML by HUPO-PSI, and '.ibd' is a binary file containing the mass spectra. This entry is for the metadata XML file

children.definition: qcML is an XML format for quality-related data of mass spectrometry and other high-throughput measurements.
children.comment: The focus of qcML is towards mass spectrometry based proteomics, but the format is suitable for metabolomics and sequencing as well.

children.definition: PRIDE XML is an XML format for mass spectra, peptide and protein identifications, and metadata about a corresponding measurement, sample, experiment.
Simulation Experiment Description Markup Language (SED-ML) is an XML format for encoding simulation setups, according to the MIASE (Minimum Information About a Simulation Experiment) requirements.
Biological Connection Markup Language (BCML) is an XML format for biological pathways.
Biological Dynamics Markup Language (BDML) is an XML format for quantitative data describing biological dynamics.
SBGN-ML is an XML format for Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN) diagrams of biological pathways or networks.
Output format used by X! series search engines that is based on the XML language BIOML.
Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL) is an XML format for the specification and exchange of biological design information in synthetic biology.
children.comment: SBOL introduces a standardised format for the electronic exchange of information on the structural and functional aspects of biological designs.

children.definition: PMML uses XML to represent mining models. The structure of the models is described by an XML Schema.
children.comment: One or more mining models can be contained in a PMML document.

children.definition: A format for storage, exchange, and processing of protein identifications created from ms/ms-derived peptide sequence data.
children.comment: No human-consumable information about this format is available (see http://tools.proteomecenter.org/wiki/index.php?title=Formats:protXML).

children.definition: XML file format for files containing information about peptide identifications from mass spectrometry data analysis carried out with OpenMS.
UniProtKB XML sequence features format is an XML format available for downloading UniProt entries.
BioC is a standardised XML format for sharing and integrating text data and annotations.
XML format for XML Schema.
Default XML format of VisANT, containing all the network information.
nmrML is an MSI supported XML-based open access format for metabolomics NMR raw and processed spectral data. It is accompanies by an nmrCV (controlled vocabulary) to allow ontology-based annotations.
OpenMS format for grouping features in one map or across several maps.
OpenMS format for quantitation results (LC/MS features).
Now deprecated data format of the HUPO Proteomics Standards Initiative.  Replaced by mzML (format_3244).
Format supported by the Tide tool for identifying peptides from tandem mass spectra.
XML format as produced by the NCBI Blast package v2.
Microsoft Powerpoint format.
XML input file format for BEAST Software (Bayesian Evolutionary Analysis Sampling Trees).
Chado-XML format is a direct mapping of the Chado relational schema into XML.
An alignment format generated by PRANK/PRANKSTER consisting of four elements: newick, nodes, selection and model.
Output xml file from the InterProScan sequence analysis application.
The KEGG Markup Language (KGML) is an exchange format of the KEGG pathway maps, which is converted from internally used KGML+ (KGML+SVG) format.
XML format for collected entries from biobliographic databases MEDLINE and PubMed.

OrthoXML is designed broadly to allow the storage and comparison of orthology data from any ortholog database. It establishes a structure for describing orthology relationships while still allowing flexibility for database-specific information to be encapsulated in the same format.
Tree structure of Protein Sequence Database Markup Language generated using Matra software.
SeqXML is an XML Schema to describe biological sequences, developed by the Stockholm Bioinformatics Centre.
XML format for the UniParc database.
XML format for the UniRef reference clusters.
A model description language for computational neuroscience.
eXtensible Markup Language (XML) format.
children.comment: Data in XML format can be serialised into text, or binary format.

children.definition: A format of raw sequence read data from an Applied Biosystems sequencing machine.
Staden Chromatogram Files format (SCF) of base-called sequence reads, qualities, and other metadata.

BAM format, the binary, BGZF-formatted compressed version of SAM format for alignment of nucleotide sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). May contain base-call and alignment qualities and other data.
AB1 binary format of raw DNA sequence reads (output of Applied Biosystems' sequencing analysis software). Contains an electropherogram and the DNA base sequence.
children.comment: AB1 uses the generic binary Applied Biosystems, Inc. Format (ABIF).

children.definition: bigBed format for large sequence annotation tracks, similar to textual BED format.
bigWig format for large sequence annotation tracks that consist of a value for each sequence position. Similar to textual WIG format.
2bit binary format of nucleotide sequences using 2 bits per nucleotide. In addition encodes unknown nucleotides and lower-case 'masking'.
.nib (nibble) binary format of a nucleotide sequence using 4 bits per nucleotide (including unknown) and its lower-case 'masking'.
Sequence Read Format (SRF) of sequence trace data. Supports submission to the NCBI Short Read Archive.
ZTR format for storing chromatogram data from DNA sequencing instruments.
BCF, the binary version of Variant Call Format (VCF) for sequence variation (indels, polymorphisms, structural variation).
Standard flowgram format (SFF) is a binary file format used to encode results of pyrosequencing from the 454 Life Sciences platform for high-throughput sequencing.
BAM indexing format
Reference-based compression of alignment format
Graphics Interchange Format.
Bowtie format for indexed reference genome for "small" genomes.
Bowtie format for indexed reference genome for "large" genomes.
Portable Document Format
Medical image format corresponding to the Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) standard.
An open file format from the Neuroimaging Informatics Technology Initiative (NIfTI) commonly used to store brain imaging data obtained using Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) methods.

Proprietary file format for (raw) BeadArray data used by genomewide profiling platforms from Illumina Inc. This format is output directly from the scanner and stores summary intensities for each probe-type on an array.
Joint Picture Group file format for lossy graphics file.
children.comment: Sequence of segments with markers. Begins with byte of 0xFF and follows by marker type.

children.definition: The Loom file format is based on HDF5, a standard for storing large numerical datasets. The Loom format is designed to efficiently hold large omics datasets. Typically, such data takes the form of a large matrix of numbers, along with metadata for the rows and columns.
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing data, based on Hierarchical Data Format (HDF).
comment: An HDF5 file appears to the user as a directed graph. The nodes of this graph are the higher-level HDF5 objects that are exposed by the HDF5 APIs: Groups, Datasets, Named datatypes. Currently supported by the Python MDTraj package.
HDF5 is the new version, according to the HDF group, a completely different technology (https://support.hdfgroup.org/products/hdf4/ compared to HDF.

children.definition: A versatile bitmap format.
children.comment: The TIFF format is perhaps the most versatile and diverse bitmap format in existence. Its extensible nature and support for numerous data compression schemes allow developers to customize the TIFF format to fit any peculiar data storage needs.

children.definition: Standard bitmap storage format in the Microsoft Windows environment.
children.comment: Although it is based on Windows internal bitmap data structures, it is supported by many non-Windows and non-PC applications.

children.definition: IM is a format used by LabEye and other applications based on the IFUNC image processing library.
children.comment: IFUNC library reads and writes most uncompressed interchange versions of this format.

children.definition: Photo CD format, which is the highest resolution format for images on a CD.
children.comment: PCD was developed by Kodak. A PCD file contains five different resolution (ranging from low to high) of a slide or film negative. Due to it PCD is often used by many photographers and graphics professionals for high-end printed applications.

children.definition: PCX is an image file format that uses a simple form of run-length encoding. It is lossless.
The PPM format is a lowest common denominator color image file format.
PSD (Photoshop Document) is a proprietary file that allows the user to work with the images' individual layers even after the file has been saved.
X BitMap is a plain text binary image format used by the X Window System used for storing cursor and icon bitmaps used in the X GUI.
children.comment: The XBM format was replaced by XPM for X11 in 1989.

children.definition: X PixMap (XPM) is an image file format used by the X Window System, it is intended primarily for creating icon pixmaps, and supports transparent pixels.
children.comment: Sequence of segments with markers. Begins with byte of 0xFF and follows by marker type.

children.definition: RGB file format is the native raster graphics file format for Silicon Graphics workstations.
The PBM format is a lowest common denominator monochrome file format. It serves as the common language of a large family of bitmap image conversion filters.
The PGM format is a lowest common denominator grayscale file format.
children.comment: It is designed to be extremely easy to learn and write programs for.

children.definition: PNG is a file format for image compression.
children.comment: It iis expected to replace the Graphics Interchange Format (GIF).

children.definition: Sun Raster is a raster graphics file format used on SunOS by Sun Microsystems
children.comment: The SVG specification is an open standard developed by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) since 1999.

children.definition: Blocked GNU Zip format.
children.comment: BAM files are compressed using a variant of GZIP (GNU ZIP), into a format called BGZF (Blocked GNU Zip Format).

children.definition: TAB-delimited genome position file index format.

ObjTables is a toolkit for creating re-usable datasets that are both human and machine-readable, combining the ease of spreadsheets (e.g., Excel workbooks) with the rigor of schemas (classes, their attributes, the type of each attribute, and the possible relationships between instances of classes). ObjTables consists of a format for describing schemas for spreadsheets, numerous data types for science, a syntax for indicating the class and attribute represented by each table and column in a workbook, and software for using schemas to rigorously validate, merge, split, compare, and revision datasets.
MS Excel spreadsheet format consisting of a set of XML documents stored in a ZIP-compressed file.
Data format used by the SQLite database conformant to the Gemini schema.
Data format used by the SQLite database.
An index of a genome database, indexed for use by the snpeff tool.

children.comment: Network Common Data Form (NetCDF) library is supported by AMBER MD package from version 9.
children.definition: Format used by netCDF software  library for writing and reading chromatography-MS data files.  Also used to store trajectory atom coordinates information, such as the ones obtained by Molecular Dynamics simulations.
A list of k-mers and their occurences in a dataset. Can also be used as an implicit De Bruijn graph.
Open Modeling EXchange format (OMEX) is a ZIPped format for encapsulating all information necessary for a modeling and simulation project in systems biology.
children.comment: An OMEX file is a ZIP container that includes a manifest file, listing the content of the archive, an optional metadata file adding information about the archive and its content, and the files describing the model. OMEX is one of the standardised formats within COMBINE (Computational Modeling in Biology Network).

children.definition: SRA archive format (SRA) is the archive format used for input to the NCBI Sequence Read Archive.
VDB ('vertical database') is the native format used for export from the NCBI Sequence Read Archive.
Index file format used by the samtools package to index TAB-delimited genome position files.
Mass spectrum file format from QSTAR and QTRAP instruments (ABI/Sciex).
Proprietary file format for mass spectrometry data from Thermo Scientific.
children.comment: Proprietary format for which documentation is not available.

children.definition: Image file format used by the Open Microscopy Environment (OME).
comment: An OME-TIFF dataset consists of one or more files in standard TIFF or BigTIFF format, with the file extension .ome.tif or .ome.tiff, and an identical (or in the case of multiple files, nearly identical) string of OME-XML metadata embedded in the ImageDescription tag of each file's first IFD (Image File Directory). BigTIFF file extensions are also permitted, with the file extension .ome.tf2, .ome.tf8 or .ome.btf, but note these file extensions are an addition to the original specification, and software using an older version of the specification may not be able to handle these file extensions.

OME develops open-source software and data format standards for the storage and manipulation of biological microscopy data. It is a joint project between universities, research establishments, industry and the software development community.

children.comment: 'BTrack' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats, and particular to its subset, the 'GTrack ecosystem' (GTrack, GSuite, BTrack). 'BTrack' is the binary, optionally compressed HDF5-based version of the GTrack and GSuite formats.
children.definition: BTrack is an HDF5-based binary format for genome or sequence feature tracks and their collections, suitable for integrative multi-track analysis. BTrack is a binary, compressed alternative to the GTrack and GSuite formats.
. proBAM is an adaptation of BAM (format_2572), which was extended to meet specific requirements entailed by proteomics data.
Binary format used by the ARB software suite
ibd is a data format for mass spectrometry imaging data.
children.comment: imzML data is recorded in 2 files: '.imzXML' is a metadata XML file based on mzML by HUPO-PSI, and '.ibd' is a binary file containing the mass spectra.

children.definition: A set of XML compliant markup components for describing multiple sequence alignments.
Proprietary file format for mass spectrometry data from Waters.
children.comment: Proprietary format for which documentation is not available, but used by multiple tools.

children.definition: HDF is the name of a set of file formats and libraries designed to store and organize large amounts of numerical data, originally developed at the National Center for Supercomputing Applications at the University of Illinois.
children.comment: HDF is currently supported by many commercial and non-commercial software platforms such as Java, MATLAB/Scilab, Octave, Python and R.

children.definition: PCAZip format is a binary compressed file to store atom coordinates based on Essential Dynamics (ED) and Principal Component Analysis (PCA).
children.comment: The compression is made projecting the Cartesian snapshots collected along the trajectory into an orthogonal space defined by the most relevant eigenvectors obtained by diagonalization of the covariance matrix (PCA). In the compression/decompression process, part of the original information is lost, depending on the final number of eigenvectors chosen. However, with a reasonable choice of the set of eigenvectors the compression typically reduces the trajectory file to less than one tenth of their original size with very acceptable loss of information. Compression with PCAZip can only be applied to unsolvated structures.

children.definition: Portable binary format for trajectories produced by GROMACS package.
children.comment: XTC uses the External Data Representation (xdr) routines for writing and reading data which were created for the Unix Network File System (NFS). XTC files use a reduced precision (lossy) algorithm which works multiplying the coordinates by a scaling factor (typically 1000), so converting them to pm (GROMACS standard distance unit is nm). This allows an integer rounding of the values. Several other tricks are performed, such as making use of atom proximity information: atoms close in sequence are usually close in space (e.g. water molecules). That makes XTC format the most efficient in terms of disk usage, in most cases reducing by a factor of 2 the size of any other binary trajectory format.

children.definition: Trajectory Next Generation (TNG) is a format for storage of molecular simulation data. It is designed and implemented by the GROMACS development group, and it is called to be the substitute of the XTC format.
children.comment: Fully architecture-independent format, regarding both endianness and the ability to mix single/double precision trajectories and I/O libraries. Self-sufficient, it should not require any other files for reading, and all the data should be contained in a single file for easy transport. Temporal compression of data, improving the compression rate of the previous XTC format. Possibility to store meta-data with information about the simulation. Direct access to a particular frame. Efficient parallel I/O.

children.definition: Scripps Research Institute BinPos format is a binary formatted file to store atom coordinates.
children.comment: It is basically a translation of the ASCII atom coordinate format to binary code. The only additional information stored is a magic number that identifies the BinPos format and the number of atoms per snapshot. The remainder is the chain of coordinates binary encoded. A drawback of this format is its architecture dependency. Integers and floats codification depends on the architecture, thus it needs to be converted if working in different platforms (little endian, big endian).

children.definition: Mash sketch is a format for sequence / sequence checksum information. To make a sketch, each k-mer in a sequence is hashed, which creates a pseudo-random identifier. By sorting these hashes, a small subset from the top of the sorted list can represent the entire sequence.
The Zarr format is an implementation of chunked, compressed, N-dimensional arrays for storing data.

A Docker image is a file, comprised of multiple layers, that is used to execute code in a Docker container. An image is essentially built from the instructions for a complete and executable version of an application, which relies on the host OS kernel.
TAR archive file format generated by the Unix-based utility tar.
children.comment: For example a 1kb transcript with 1000 alignments in a sample of 10 million reads (out of which 8 million reads can be mapped) will have RPKM = 1000/(1 * 8) = 125

children.definition: The proprietary native video format of various Microsoft programs such as Windows Media Player.
ZIP is an archive file format that supports lossless data compression.
children.comment: A ZIP file may contain one or more files or directories that may have been compressed.

children.definition: Zeiss' proprietary image format based on TIFF.
children.comment: LSM files are the default data export for the Zeiss LSM series confocal microscopes (e.g. LSM 510, LSM 710). In addition to the image data, LSM files contain most imaging settings.

children.definition: GNU zip compressed file format common to Unix-based operating systems.
Audio Video Interleaved (AVI) format is a multimedia container format for AVI files, that allows synchronous audio-with-video playback.
A declaration file format for UCSC browsers track dataset display charateristics.
STL is a file format native to the stereolithography CAD software created by 3D Systems.  The format is used to save and share surface-rendered 3D images and also for 3D printing.

U3D (Universal 3D) is a compressed file format and data structure for 3D computer graphics. It contains 3D model information such as triangle meshes, lighting, shading, motion data, lines and points with color and structure.
Bitmap image format used for storing textures.
children.comment: Texture files can create the appearance of different surfaces and can be applied to both 2D and 3D objects. Note the file extension .tex is also used for LaTex documents which are a completely different format and they are NOT interchangable.

children.definition: A digital multimedia container format most commonly used to store video and audio.
Format used by Python pickle module for serializing and de-serializing a Python object structure.

The standard binary file format used by NumPy - a fundamental package for scientific computing with Python - for persisting a single arbitrary NumPy array on disk. The format stores all of the shape and dtype information necessary to reconstruct the array correctly.
Format of repertoire (archive) files that can be read by SimToolbox (a MATLAB toolbox for structured illumination fluorescence microscopy) or alternatively extracted with zip file archiver software.
Format used by the Zstandard real-time compression algorith.
Binary format.
children.comment: Only specific native binary formats are listed under 'Binary format' in EDAM. Generic binary formats - such as any data being zipped, or any XML data being serialised into the Efficient XML Interchange (EXI) format - are not modelled in EDAM. Refer to http://wsio.org/compression_004.

children.definition: The format of iHOP (Information Hyperlinked over Proteins) text-mining result.
FASTA format wrapped in HTML elements.
EMBL entry format wrapped in HTML elements.
Genbank entry format wrapped in HTML elements.

children.comment: MHTML is not strictly an HTML format, it is encoded as an HTML email message (although with multipart/related instead of multipart/alternative). It, however, contains the main HTML block as its core, and thus it is for practical reasons incuded in EDAM as a specialisation of 'HTML'.
children.definition: MIME  HTML format for Web pages, which can include external resources, including images, Flash animations and so on.
HTML format.
SMILES ARbitrary Target Specification (SMARTS) format for chemical structure specification, which is a subset of the SMILES line notation.
Chemical structure specified in Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry System (SMILES) line notation.
Chemical structure specified in IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI) line notation.
Chemical structure specified by Molecular Formula (MF), including a count of each element in a compound.
children.comment: The general MF query format consists of a series of valid atomic symbols, with an optional number or range.

children.definition: The InChIKey (hashed InChI) is a fixed length (25 character) condensed digital representation of an InChI chemical structure specification. It uniquely identifies a chemical compound.
children.comment: An InChIKey identifier is not human- nor machine-readable but is more suitable for web searches than an InChI chemical structure specification.

children.definition: BpForms is a string format for concretely representing the primary structures of biopolymers, including DNA, RNA, and proteins that include non-canonical nucleic and amino acids. See https://www.bpforms.org for more information.
Text format of a chemical formula.
Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.

Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.

Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
Alphabet for any protein sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.

Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but possibly with non-sequence characters.

children.comment: 'BioXSD' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats. 'BioXSD in XML' is the XML format based on the common, unified 'BioXSD data model', a.k.a. 'BioXSD|BioJSON|BioYAML'.
children.definition: BioXSD-schema-based XML format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, Web services, and object-oriented programming.
Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
